summary: This document details the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell by the FBI's New York Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire. It outlines the circumstances of her arrest, the charges against her, and her initial interactions with law enforcement during the arrest process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to a federal warrant for multiple charges including conspiracy to entice minors and perjury.

persons.name: Martin Jackson
persons.context: Martin Jackson was identified as a member of Maxwell's security team who was observed running with a handheld radio during the arrest.

connections.description: Martin Jackson is identified as a member of Ghislaine Maxwell's security team, indicating a professional relationship.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI at her residence in Bradford, New Hampshire, following a federal warrant.

locations: 338 East Washington Road, Bradford, New Hampshire
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested without incident at her residence on July 2, 2020.
She was charged with conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
During the arrest, a cell phone was discovered in her room, which she chose to bring with her.
Maxwell inquired about the number of victims related to the enticement charge during her transport.
